title: Frank Zappa - The Lost Episodes (1996) [EAC-FLAC]
description:
Frank Zappa - The Lost Episodes (1996) [EAC-FLAC]
               EAC rip (secure mode) | FLAC (tracks)+CUE+LOG -> 422 Mb
                        Full Artwork @ 600 dpi (png) 131 Mb



This lavish set (a 30-song CD accompanied by a 48-page book and all enclosed in a slipcase) was among Frank Zappa's final projects before his death in late '93. It was assembled from over thirty years of recordings. 

The earliest are from '59--one is of The Blackouts in which Zappa was the drummer, while the other features Don Van Vliet as vocalist with the Zappa brothers (Frank on Bobby) on guitars. There's a '61 recording of "Take Your Clothes Off When You Dance" (which made its official recorded debut seven years later on The Mothers Of Invention's WE'RE ONLY IN IT FOR THE MONEY), audio verite snippets, and film soundtrack music Zappa scored and recorded in '63. There are also solo pieces scored for synthesizers and original versions of pieces recorded by his '70s and '80s bands. From doo-wop to Edgar Varese, this is as close to autobiographical as any one Zappa album can be--and smartly edited and sequenced to boot!.



THE LOST EPISODES is a collection of rare and previously-unreleased tracks spanning Frank Zappa's career.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Personnel includes: 

Frank Zappa (vocals, guitar, kazoo, piano, celeste, Synclavier, synthesizer, bass, drums, percussion); Don "Sugar Cane" Harris (vocals, violin, electric violin); Tommy Mars (vocals, keyboards); Wayne Lyles, Don "Captain Beefheart" Van Vliet, Ronnie Williams, Kenny Williams, Ricky Lancelotti, Terry Bozzio, Dale Bozzio, Ray White, Ike Willis, Ray Collins, All-Night John (vocals); Elwood Jr. Madeo, Bobby Zappa (guitar); Elliot "Winged Eel Fingerling" Ingber (slide guitar); Jean-Luc Ponty (violin); Ian Underwood (woodwinds, saxophone, Fender Rhodes electric piano, keyboards); Tony Rodriguez (alto saxophone); Chuck Foster, Sal Marquez (trumpet); Bruce Fowler (trombone); Danny Helferin, Terry Wimberly (piano); Don Preston, George Duke (keyboards); Art Tripp (marimba, vibraphone); Roy Estrada, Caronga Ward, Janschi, Erroneous, Tom Fowler, Arthur Barrow, Max Bennett (bass); Chuck Grove, Vic Mortenson, Jimmy Carl Black, John "Drumbo" French, Aynsley Dunbar, Chester Thompson, Ralph Humphrey, John Guerin, Vinnie Colaiuta (drums); Ruth Underwood (percussion); Dick Barber.
